results.title: Push
results.brief_description: This engaging work explores the narrative device of ‘what if?’ to create a quirky and fun filled piece demonstrating sophisticated control of compositing in a playful exploration of the possibilities of technology.

results.title: The Note
results.brief_description:
This mature exploration of difficult relationships utilises understated camerawork to convey an assured and gripping narrative. Strong visual composition and the use of motif combine with an effective soundtrack to create a piece that does not underestimate the role of the audience.
Music composed and performed by Madeleine Jay. ‘Moonlight Sonata’ by Beethoven.

results.title: The Lane game
results.brief_description: In a sophisticated homage to existentialism this carefully paced and engaging work features strong performances supported by well controlled sound, effective night lighting and an assured control of editing in extended shot, reverse shot conversations.

results.title: Fretlink
results.brief_description: Inspired by early animation technologies this experimental work on a familiar subject employs the mechanical animation of still images to create the illusion of movement. The layered original soundtrack complements the ideas presented.

results.title: Frequency
results.brief_description: A mockumentary which takes an oft debated subject as its premise. Clever scripting combines with production and post-production elements including effective use of camera and editing to develop a range of age appropriate characters in an engaging way.

results.title: Bus stop
results.brief_description:
This animation employs a fearless use of monochrome to enhance its sophisticated intertextual referencing of classic cartoons. The original music both supports and acts as a counterpoint to the storyline.
‘Fast lane’ performed by Lucid.

results.title: Black, white and all shades of grey
results.brief_description: A well-acted, taut noir drama featuring a strong narrative supported by great lighting and controlled use of tone and colour. The work makes economic use of locations to evoke time and place.

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: Amour de la toilette
results.brief_description:
Subtlety is the key to this brilliantly conceived hand drawn animation that employs the simple technology of a whiteboard and markers to create an engaging evocation of Paris. The use of minimalist materials is supported by thorough planning skills, the controlled use of camera and a storyline that is achievable within the limitations of the medium.
Music by The Cafe Accordian Orchestra.
